question.body: Vitreous humor is found between which two eye structures?

response.feedback: Incorrect. This is the location of the aqueous humor.
Incorrect. The conjunctive secretes mucus and covers the anterior part of the sclera and inside eyelid.
Incorrect. The vascular choroid layer is between these two.
Incorrect. This is the location of the aqueous humor.
Correct. The vitreous humor is posterior to the lens and helps hold the retina in position against the back of the eye.

part.hint: This is the more viscous inner eye fluid produced once in your life, while aqueous is more watery and produced continually through your life.
